item.title: OpenAI says it’s turned off app suggestions that look like ads
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: While OpenAI continues to insist that there are currently no ads — or tests for advertising — live in ChatGPT, the company’s chief research officer also acknowledged that the company “fell short” with recent promotional messages.

item.title: Is it time to ‘refound’ your startup?
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Sometimes, founding a startup just once isn’t enough.

item.title: Ex-Googler’s Yoodli triples valuation to $300M+ with AI built to assist, not replace, people
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Yoodli counts Google, Snowflake, and Databricks among its customers.

item.title: Sources: AI synthetic research startup Aaru raised a Series A at a $1B ‘headline’ valuation
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: The one-year-old startup, which does market research on simulated populations, had a multi-tier valuation round, sources tell TechCrunch.

item.title: AWS needs you to believe in AI agents
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: AWS announced a wave of new AI agent tools at re:Invent 2025, but can Amazon actually catch up to the AI leaders? While the cloud giant is betting big on enterprise AI with its third-gen chip and database discounts that got developers cheering, it’s still fighting to prove it can compete beyond infrastructure.  This week […]

item.title: This startup built a Fitbit for your brain to combat chronic stress
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Forenza collaborated with data scientists and biomedical engineers to develop Awear, a small device worn behind the ear for continuous brainwave monitoring. The device transmits results to an app, which provides information about the wearer’s mood and offers AI-powered coaching advice for managing stress and improving emotional resilience.

item.title: Meta acquires AI device startup Limitless
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Limitless said it shares Meta's vision of bringing personal superintelligence to everyone.

item.title: Nothing wants your money, AWS wants your trust, and Spotify wants your data
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo, Anthony Ha, Kirsten Korosec, Sean O'Kane
item.description: AWS announced a wave of new AI agent tools at re:Invent 2025, but can Amazon actually catch up to the AI leaders? While the cloud giant is betting big on enterprise AI with its third-gen chip and database discounts that got developers cheering, it’s still fighting to prove it can compete beyond infrastructure.  This week […]

item.title: New streaming channel launches to give viewers a peek into city council meetings
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Hamlet TV is a way to help keep citizens informed of what's happening inside local governments.

item.title: From the NFL to Startup Battlefield: How Alltroo built a brand that wins
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Johannessen
item.description: On season one of Build Mode: Product, Meet Market, we explore what it really takes to get your product into the hands of customers.

item.title: Celebrity Co-Founders Not Required: Building Influence from Scratch
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Johannessen
item.description: Alltroo co-founders Kyle Rudolph and Jon Walburg share how they transformed their pro-athlete star power into a fundraising platform that allows their community the ability to donate to a variety of organization and win high-value prizes. In this episode of Build Mode, they reveal how they leveraged their networks to disrupt the charitable giving industry, […]

item.title: Your network is your first go-to-market strategy
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Johannessen, Maggie Nye
item.description: Alltroo co-founders Kyle Rudolph and Jon Walburg share how they transformed their pro-athlete star power into a fundraising platform that allows their community the ability to donate to a variety of organization and win high-value prizes. In this episode of Build Mode, they reveal how they leveraged their networks to disrupt the charitable giving industry, […]

item.title: Nexus isn’t going all in on AI, keeping half of its new $700M fund for India startups
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Nexus Venture Partners manages $3.2 billion in capital across its funds and has invested in more than 130 companies over the years.

item.title: Day One Ventures’ Masha Bucher on why every founder needs to be an influencer
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: Tech is racing ahead while society struggles to keep up. Masha Bucher, founder and GP of Day One Ventures, built her firm around closing that gap by combining venture capital with hands-on PR to help portfolio companies not just raise money, but actually break through the noise.   Day One’s been an early backer of companies like World, Superhuman, and Remote.com, with 12 […]

item.title: Amazon hopes to jump-start its AI coding tool Kiro by giving it away to startups
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Can Kiro win the hearts of startup founders above the many AI coding tools they already have? Amazon hopes a free year will tempt them.

item.title: VCs deploy ‘kingmaking’ strategy to crown AI winners in their infancy
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: While VCs have long used big investments to spur category winners, they are taking this strategy to new extremes.

item.title: Company backed by Donald Trump Jr.’s firm nabs $620M government contract
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Vulcan Elements, a rare-earth magnets startup, has secured a $620 million contract from the U.S. defense department.

item.title: This VC charges $0 for PR, and has 12 unicorns to show for it
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan, Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: Tech is racing ahead while society struggles to keep up. Masha Bucher, founder and GP of Day One Ventures, built her firm around closing that gap by combining venture capital with hands-on PR to help portfolio companies not just raise money, but actually break through the noise.   Day One’s been an early backer of companies […]

item.title: Tonight, the future of deep tech will be explained to you at StrictlyVC Palo Alto
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: On Wednesday evening at Playground Global in Palo Alto, some very smart people who are building things you don't understand yet will explain what's coming. This is the final StrictlyVC event of 2025, and truly, the lineup is ridiculous.

item.title: Kalshi raises $1B at $11B valuation, doubling value in under two months
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: The latest funding comes less than two months after Kalshi announced that it raised $300 million at a $5 billion valuation.
